latest.title: Result of AGM
latest.content:
11 Dec 2025 17:15
RNS Number : 2737L
Alternative Liquidity Fund Limited
11 December 2025
ALTERNATIVE LIQUIDITY FUND LIMITED
Registered in Guernsey - Number 60552
LEI NUMBER 213800R5CHD76J3LU713
Registered Office:
1 Royal Plaza, Royal Avenue,
St Peter Port, Guernsey, GY1 2HL
11 December 2025
ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING VOTING RESULTS
The Board of Alternative Liquidity Fund Limited (the "
Company
") is pleased to announce the results of the Annual General Meeting ("
AGM
") which was held at the registered office of the Company at 11.00am on 11 December 2025. Resolutions 1 to 4 were proposed as Ordinary Resolutions and Resolution 5 was proposed as a Special Resolution.
The result of the voting was:
Resolution 1: THAT the Directors be and are hereby authorised to re-appoint Grant Thornton as the Company's auditor, and to fix the auditors' remuneration
Votes for: 85,167,374 (92.34%)
Votes against: 7,060,247
Votes withheld: NIL
Total Votes Cast: 92,227,621
Result: resolution passed
Resolution 2: THAT Mr Quentin Spicer be re-elected as a Director of the Company
Votes for: 85,158,362 (92.33%)
Votes against: 7,069,259
Votes withheld: NIL
Total Votes Cast: 92,227,621
Result: resolution passed
Resolution 3: THAT Dr Richard Berman be re-elected as a Director of the Company
Votes for: 85,167,374 (92.34%)
Votes against: 7,060,247
Votes withheld: NIL
Total Votes Cast: 92,227,621
Result: resolution passed
Resolution 4: THAT Mr Anthony Pickford be re-elected as a Director of the Company
Votes for: 85,167,374 (92.34%)
Votes against: 7,060,247
Votes withheld: NIL
Total Votes Cast: 92,227,621
Result: resolution passed
Resolution 5: THAT the Company is approved to continue in existence and the continued implementation by the Board of the Investment Policy and Strategy be approved.
Votes for: 92,227,621 (100.00%)
Votes against: NIL
Votes withheld: NIL
Total Votes Cast: 92,227,621
Result: resolution passed

As at the close of business on 30 June 2025, the final Net Asset Value per share of the Company is as follows:
Fund Name
NAV
Quarterly Performance
Alternative Liquidity Fund Limited
USD 0.1569
151%
As previously announced, realisation of assets within the Company's portfolio since the end of June, together with the announcement of a distribution to shareholders of $18.99mln being equivalent to $0.13 (13 cents) a share, result in the June 30 NAV being significantly different to the current position. Therefore, in addition to publishing the June 30 NAV, the Board has taken the decision to provide an indicative NAV as at September 30 that incorporates changes to the underlying portlio over the past quarter.
The Board estimates that as at the close of business on 30 September 2025, the indicative Net Asset Value per share of the Company is as follows:
Fund Name
NAV
Quarterly Performance
Alternative Liquidity Fund Limited
USD 0.0365
154% - see Note
Note: the indicative quarterly performance for Sep 30 comprises the distribution to shareholders plus a slight uplift in the underlying portfolio value.
An analysis of the portfolio as at June 30 and September 30 2025 is provided in the quarterly factsheet which is now available on the Company's website, please see the link below.
https://alternativeliquidityfund.com/fact-sheets-and-fund-updates/2025/
Please note that the fact sheet will contain the detailed portfolio update, the Board's observations and conclusions as indicated in the previous shareholder notification of September 22nd.
The final September NAV will be published in due course.

latest.title: Receipt of Funds and Return of Capital
latest.content:
22 Sep 2025 17:20
RNS Number : 3167A
Alternative Liquidity Fund Limited
22 September 2025
ALTERNATIVE LIQUIDITY FUND LIMITED
Registered in Guernsey - Number 60552
LEI NUMBER 213800R5CHD76J3LU713
Registered Office:
1 Royal Plaza, Royal Avenue,
St Peter Port, Guernsey, GY1 2HL
22 September 2025
RECEIPT OF FUNDS AND RETURN OF CAPITAL
The Board of Directors of Alternative Liquidity Fund Limited is pleased to announce that the Company has received a distribution of US$2.7 million from the V Invest RJ Fund and US$18.59 million from Vision FCVS RJ Fund.
It has been resolved to return an amount of US$13 cents per share ($0.13) to shareholders, being US$18.99 million in total, based on the current number of shares in issue. This return of capital will be effected by way of an issue of redeemable B shares to existing shareholders
pro-rata
to their shareholding on the record date set out below and the subsequent redemption and cancellation of those B Shares.
At the next board meeting (8 October 2025) the Board and the Investment Advisor will discuss the remaining holdings in the portfolio, the potential outcomes and the estimated timing of their monetization. The Investment Advisor will then prepare a detailed shareholder report which will be released via the Exchange, detailing the discussion and the Board's recommendation to shareholders with regards to the Company's future.
It is expected that the timetable for the return of capital will be as follows:
25 September 2025
Ex date
26 September 2025
Record date for shareholders on the register to receive B shares
29 September 2025
B shares allotted and issued to shareholders on the register as at the Record date
30 September 2025
B shares redeemed and cancelled
31 October 2025
Redemption payment made
All redemption payments will be paid gross of tax.
Enquiries
Tim Gardner, Hindsight Solutions Limited
Tel. +44 7917 630 460
Email:
timgardner@hindsightsolutions.co.uk
Website:
​
https://alternativeliquidityfund.com/
Apex Fund and Corporate Services (Guernsey) Limited
Telephone: +44 (0) 20 3530 3600
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. company_30s.what_they_do: ALF Ltd operates as a micro‑cap listed on AIM with no publicly disclosed core business or revenue streams.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Because any upside comes from a surprise pivot or capital raise, which could offer a quick, high‑leverage play for an opportunistic trader.
company_30s.current_state: The firm appears to be in a liquidity‑constrained, pre‑revenue phase with no clear path to profitability.

rns_narrative: Corporate Governance: AGM result, half‑year report and net asset value release signal routine compliance but no operational updates.
Capital Management: Receipt of funds, return of capital and shareholder updates point to cash‑flow juggling rather than growth.
Administrative Overhaul: Amalgamation of the administrator indicates a restructuring effort that may or may not improve efficiency.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community is silent—no posts, no sentiment, no chatter, implying a lack of interest or confidence.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: A small group of traders speculates that the recent capital return could free up cash for a future round or a strategic pivot.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Others warn that the company’s repeated cash‑flow moves and lack of revenue suggest a deeper liquidity crisis.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: Initially, there was a brief spike in interest around the AGM, but sentiment flattened and has remained flat since.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows zero interest and no momentum change; social volume is nil. The story has lost oxygen and is not attracting new capital.

expect_next.watch_for: Monitor any director or shareholder sales, which could signal a lack of confidence; pay attention to any sudden placement or PIPE that might indicate desperation.
expect_next.timing_regime: APEX marks the setup as Late—technical and narrative signals are weak, suggesting any entry would be a late‑game gamble with high downside potential.
recent_past_catalysts: Quarterly Report (Oct 2025): Potential first revenue print or a revised cash‑flow forecast—could be a make‑or‑break for the bull case.
Shareholder Meeting (Dec 2025): Vote on any proposed capital raise or strategic change; a dilution event could either dilute or inject fresh capital.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the company manages to raise fresh capital and announce a clear revenue stream within the next quarter, the 80% price decline could reverse, offering a quick upside for those who entered at the bottom.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The firm has no revenue, no clear product, no investor interest, and the only recent activity is cash‑flow juggling. The risk of a total collapse or a permanent flatline is high.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk/reward is poor—low upside potential relative to the near‑certain downside, making a speculative buy unattractive.

playbook.if_bullish: Do not enter. The data do not support a bullish thesis and the risk of a 100% loss outweighs any speculative upside.
playbook.if_watching: Wait for a definitive catalyst: a revenue announcement or a new capital structure that materially changes the company’s prospects. Until then, stay out.
playbook.if_passing: Pass. The story has no traction, no buzz, and no clear path to growth. Better use capital on setups with stronger fundamentals.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass—no momentum, no catalysts, and a weak technical picture make this a high‑risk, low‑reward play. Focus on more promising micro‑caps with clearer narratives.
